alert.note: Alert for Coahoma; Quitman; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 05 at 2:18PM CDT until May 05 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Lee County in eastern Arkansas... Northeastern Phillips County in eastern Arkansas... Northeastern Coahoma County in northwestern Mississippi... Tunica County in northwestern Mississippi... Northern Quitman County in northwestern Mississippi... * Until 300 PM CDT. * At 218 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles south of Lexa, or 8 miles west of Helena-West Helena, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Helena-West Helena, St Francis National Park, Friars Point, Tunica, Sledge, Lexa, Dubbs, North Tunica, Dundee, Little Texas, Lula, Falcon, Gerlach Mill, Moon, Preston Place, Quarles, Austin, Westover, Jeffries and Wycamp. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
